body.p:
Lancaster Ky.
6th October 1863
To his Excellency Gov Bramlette

The undersigned citizens afa Garrard County & many of us neighbors of the family of Jacob Wearren and would respectfully represent that at the March term 1854 of the Madison Circut Court an Indictment for Tippling was found or Jacob Wearren, and at the Sept term of said Court there was a verdict & Judgmt for $60 fine and $10.80 cost of action. That shortly thereafter he rendered to this county where he continued to reside up to the time of his death, which occurred on the day of February 1863. That he left a widow & four children. The eldest of whom is not exceeding 12 years of age and is a girl, that he left some little property, but not a sufficiency to support his helpless family and educate his children as it should be done. That since his death execution has issued on sd Judgt ^to wit 28th September 1863^ returnable 2nd Monday in October (With Madison Circuit Court) & is now in the hands of the Sheriff of Garrard County for collection. Now the persons considered, we respectfully Petition Your Excellency
to remit said fine or so much thereof as the case warrants. The case well merits the clemency of the Executive.

Admr. Jas. A. Anderson
W. D. Hopper Clk Garrard Cir Court,
